# GTKX

> GTKX is a modern framework for building native Linux applications using React and GTK. It provides the full range of GTK4, GLib, and Node.js APIs, allowing you to create rich, performant desktop applications with the tools and libraries you already know.

## Core Packages

- `@gtkx/react`: React reconciler, GTK/Adwaita intrinsic elements, render() function, createPortal() function
- `@gtkx/ffi`: TypeScript FFI bindings, GLib type definitions and enums
- `@gtkx/css`: CSS-in-JS styling (Powered by Emotion)
- `@gtkx/testing`: Component testing utilities (Testing Library-style API for GTK)
- `@gtkx/cli`: Project scaffolding (gtkx create), dev server with HMR, and production bundling (gtkx build)
- `@gtkx/mcp`: MCP server for AI-powered app interaction, widget tree inspection, automated testing

## Documentation

- [Introduction](https://gtkx.dev/docs/introduction): What GTKX is, how it works, architecture overview, and target audience
- [Getting Started](https://gtkx.dev/docs/getting-started): Create first app, project structure, basic component patterns
- [CLI Reference](https://gtkx.dev/docs/cli): gtkx create, gtkx dev, gtkx build commands, npm scripts, programmatic API
- [FFI Bindings](https://gtkx.dev/docs/ffi-bindings): Importing GTK/GLib bindings, async methods, cancellation, error handling
- [Styling](https://gtkx.dev/docs/styling): css(), cx(), injectGlobal()
- [Portals and Dialogs](https://gtkx.dev/docs/portals): createPortal(), rendering dialogs and popovers outside the normal component tree
- [Animations](https://gtkx.dev/docs/animations): x.Animation declarative animation component, timed and spring modes, exit animations
- [x.* Elements](https://gtkx.dev/docs/x-elements): Grid layout, fixed positioning, overlays, notebook pages, rich text, keyboard shortcuts
- [Lists](https://gtkx.dev/docs/lists): GtkListView, GtkGridView, GtkColumnView, GtkDropDown examples
- [Menus](https://gtkx.dev/docs/menus): x.MenuItem, x.MenuSection, x.MenuSubmenu examples
- [Slots](https://gtkx.dev/docs/slots): Named child positions (x.Slot) for widgets like GtkPaned, GtkMenuButton; x.ContainerSlot for widgets like HeaderBar, ToolbarView
- [Adwaita](https://gtkx.dev/docs/adwaita): Adwaita x.* components examples
- [Testing](https://gtkx.dev/docs/testing): render(), renderHook(), screen queries and userEvent utilities, testing patterns
- [MCP Integration](https://gtkx.dev/docs/mcp): AI assistant integration via Model Context Protocol, widget tree inspection, automated UI interaction
- [Deploying](https://gtkx.dev/docs/deploying): Node.js Single Executable Application (SEA), Flatpak/Snap packaging
